news-item.title: JP Morgan Emerging Markets Investment Trust keeps rising: up 2.2% in 2 days
news-item.source: News Bites - Western Europe: United Kingdom
news-item.text:
JP Morgan Emerging Markets Investment Trust (L:JMG), the 28th largest equity investment instruments company by market capitalisation in the United Kingdom, extended its gains Tuesday, rising an additional GBX6.0 (or 1.2%) to close at GBX520.0. The units have lifted GBX11.0 (or 2.2%) over the past two trading days. Compared with the FTSE 100 Index which rose 77.4 points (or 1.19%) in the two days, this represented a relative price increase of 1.0%. To download our Detailed Research Report (PDF), giving comprehensive trading and background information on JP Morgan Emerging Markets Investment Trust, please click http://www.buysellsignals.com/0010518316603143473 Bullish SignalsUptrend- The unit rose 1.2%, for a 2-day rise of 2.2%, on high volatility today and expanding price range.- The price increased 0.5% in the last week and 1.7% in the last month.Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Undervaluation:- Price to Book of 0.8 [1.0]. - Return on Assets 10.3% [9.2%].Other Bullish Signals:- The P/E of 7.3 multiplied by the P/NTA of 0.8 is 5.6. Being less than the Benjamin Graham benchmark of 22.5 the unit appears undervalued. - Tobin's Q Ratio, defined as MCap divided by Total Assets, is 0.8. Compared with the rest of the market the unit is undervalued.- Return on Assets and Return on Equity have shown signs of recovery in recent years.[Year ended, all figures in %]
NoteVolume: there were 86,929 units worth GBX45.2 million (US$750,371) traded. Trading volume was 19% lighter than average. Beta: the Beta of JP Morgan Emerging Markets Investment Trust unit is 0.8. A Beta lower than 1 suggests this is a low risk, low return unit with volatility less than that of the market. - The present value of GBP1,000 (PV1000) invested one year ago in JP Morgan Emerging Markets Investment Trust is GBP835, including a capital loss of GBP173 and dividend reinvested of GBP8. Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Parity:- Price/Earnings of 7.3 [7.4]. Bearish Signals:- The 4.2% premium to 12-month low of GBX498.94 against the 18.8% discount to high of GBX640.0 suggests the unit continues to push for new lows.Fundamental measures by comparison with the sector average [in brackets] indicate Overvaluation:- Price/Sales of 6.3 [4.2]. - Return on Equity 10.4% [12.1%].Other Bearish Signals:- As per the Du Pont analysis, Return on Equity of 10.4% is lower than sector average of 12.1%. This is computed as net profit margin of 85.7% times asset turnover [sales/assets] of 0.12 times leverage factor [total assets/shareholders' equity] of 1.0.
